name: Matar Pulao
history: Matar Pulao, also known as Peas Pulao, is a popular and simple rice dish in Indian cuisine. It combines the flavors of fragrant basmati rice with the sweetness of green peas, and is often seasoned with whole spices for a subtle yet aromatic taste.
description: Matar Pulao is a light and flavorful dish made with basmati rice and green peas. This pulao is typically spiced with cumin, cloves, and other whole spices, and it's a versatile dish that pairs well with various curries and accompaniments.

ingredients.item: whole spices (bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cloves, green cardamoms)

instructions.title: Prepare the Rice
instructions.description: Rinse the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak the rice for 20 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Spices and Onions
instructions.description: Heat ghee or oil in a pot. Add cumin seeds and whole spices. Once they sizzle, add the sliced onion and sautÃ© until golden brown. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste.

instructions.title: Cook Rice and Peas
instructions.description: Add the drained rice and green peas to the pot. SautÃ© for a couple of minutes. Pour in water, add salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fluff the rice gently with a fork before serving. Serve the Matar Pulao hot, garnished with additional fried onions or fresh herbs if desired.

tips: Soaking the rice beforehand helps in cooking it faster and makes it fluffier.
Adjust the amount of water depending on the type and age of the rice.
variations: Add a pinch of saffron soaked in warm milk for a richer flavor.
Include other vegetables like carrots or beans for added nutrition and color.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stovetop with a little added water.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with fresh cilantro or mint leaves.
Pair with raita or a simple yogurt-based salad for a complete meal.
